intro: Urtica crenata, commonly known as the hairy nettle, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges and is covered in fine, stinging hairs. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in moist, shady environments. Its flowers are small and greenish, appearing in clusters, and it is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Urtica crenata is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
